SEARCH
Package org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core

Class CloudSimShutdown

java.lang.Object
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.SimEntity
org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSimShutdown
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class CloudSimShutdown extends SimEntity
CloudimShutdown waits for termination of all CloudSim user entities to determine the end of simulation. This class will be created by CloudSim upon initialisation of the simulation, i.e. done via CloudSim.init() method. Hence, do not need to worry about creating an object of this class. This object signals the end of simulation to CloudInformationService (CIS) entity.
Since:
CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
Author:
Manzur Murshed, Rajkumar Buyya

  • Constructor Details

    • CloudSimShutdown

      public CloudSimShutdown(String name, int numUser) throws Exception
      Instantiates a new CloudSimShutdown object.

      The total number of cloud user entities plays an important role to determine whether all hostList' should be shut down or not. If one or more users are still not finished, then the hostList's will not be shut down. Therefore, it is important to give a correct number of total cloud user entities. Otherwise, CloudSim program will hang or encounter a weird behaviour.

      Parameters:
      name - the name to be associated with this entity (as required by SimEntity class)
      numUser - total number of cloud user entities
      Throws:
      Exception - when creating this entity before initialising CloudSim package or this entity name is null or empty
      See Also:
      • CloudSim.init(int, java.util.Calendar, boolean)
      Precondition:
      name != null, numUser >= 0
      Postcondition:
      $none

  • Method Details

    • processEvent

      public void processEvent(SimEvent ev)
      The main method that shuts down hostList's and Cloud Information Service (CIS). In addition, this method writes down a report at the end of a simulation based on reportWriterName defined in the Constructor.
      NOTE: This method shuts down cloud hostList's and CIS entities either AFTER all cloud users have been shut down or an entity requires an abrupt end of the whole simulation. In the first case, the number of cloud users given in the Constructor must be correct. Otherwise, CloudSim package hangs forever or it does not terminate properly.
      Specified by:
      processEvent in class SimEntity
      Parameters:
      ev - the ev
      Precondition:
      $none
      Postcondition:
      $none
